perturbation.original_text: Each Party or any of its Affiliates providing services hereunder shall be a “Provider,” and each Party or any of its Affiliates receiving services hereunder shall be a “Recipient.”
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party or any of its Affiliates providing services hereunder shall be a “Service Provider,” and each Party or any of its Affiliates receiving services hereunder shall be a “Recipient.”
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Provider' is used consistently throughout the agreement. By changing it to 'Service Provider' in the definition but not elsewhere, creates confusion as to whether these terms are interchangeable, potentially affecting obligations and liabilities.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 3.1 Quality of Services.
(a) Provider shall perform the Services (i) at a level of quality substantially similar in all material respects to that at which such Services were performed or enjoyed during the twelve (12) month period prior to the date hereof and (ii) in accordance with applicable Law (collectively, (i) and (ii), the “Service Standard”). Subject to Section 3.1(c), internal controls of Provider and its Affiliates with respect to the Service Standard shall remain materially the same in effect throughout the term of this Agreement. Each Party acknowledges that the other Party and their Affiliates are not professional service providers of the Services.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 3.1 Quality of Services.
(a) Provider shall perform the Services (i) at a level of quality substantially similar in all material respects to that at which such Services were performed or enjoyed during the twelve (12) month period prior to the date hereof and (ii) in accordance with applicable Law (collectively, (i) and (ii), the “Service Standard”). Subject to Section 3.1(c), internal controls of the Performing Party and its Affiliates with respect to the Service Standard shall remain materially the same in effect throughout the term of this Agreement. Each Party acknowledges that the other Party and their Affiliates are not professional service providers of the Services.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Provider' is replaced with 'Performing Party' within Section 3.1(a). This introduces an inconsistency as 'Provider' is defined in the preamble, while 'Performing Party' is not, creating ambiguity about which entity is responsible for maintaining the Service Standard's internal controls.

perturbation.original_text: Section 5.1 Fees. Recipient shall pay Provider (i) the fee for each Service set forth on Exhibit A or Exhibit B, (ii) Providers’ and their Affiliates’ reasonable and documented out-of-pocket expenses incurred in providing the Services, including the third-party fees and expenses that are charged to Recipient or their Affiliates in connection with provision of the Services (including any fees and expenses charged by subcontractors permitted to provide the Services under Section 2.2) but excluding payments made to employees of Provider or any of their Affiliates pursuant to Section 5.2, and (iii) any other fees as agreed to by the Parties in writing (collectively, the “Fees”).
perturbation.changed_text: Section 5.1 Fees. Recipient shall pay Vendor (i) the fee for each Service set forth on Exhibit A or Exhibit B, (ii) Providers’ and their Affiliates’ reasonable and documented out-of-pocket expenses incurred in providing the Services, including the third-party fees and expenses that are charged to Recipient or their Affiliates in connection with provision of the Services (including any fees and expenses charged by subcontractors permitted to provide the Services under Section 2.2) but excluding payments made to employees of Provider or any of their Affiliates pursuant to Section 5.2, and (iii) any other fees as agreed to by the Parties in writing (collectively, the “Fees”).
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Provider' is replaced with 'Vendor' within Section 5.1. This introduces an inconsistency as 'Provider' is defined in the preamble, while 'Vendor' is not, creating ambiguity about which entity is entitled to receive payment for the services.
